title: Amsterdam & Antwerpen
content:
Hello everyone!

I’m leaving Stockholm for Amsterdam and Antwerpen in late November and I was wondering if somebody could help me with site propositions (typography related of course), anything from bookstores to cemeteries. All suggestions will be greatly appreciated.

KTKM

 [‹ Female Type Designers – “is there anybody out there?”](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203111640/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38754 "Go to previous forum topic") [is anyone watching BBC1 right now? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203111640/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38870 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Kristian M

comments.content:
If you’re going to Amsterdam, you should definately go to Nijhof & Lee bookshop at Staalstraat 13a. You can also go and visit Ewald Spieker (just around the corner from the bookshop) at his Typogallery (if he is in). A very kind man who always has time for a chat.

Best,  
Mark

The library of the University of Amsterdam has a ›special collections‹ department.

New location & reading room. Frequent exhibitions.

[http://www.uba.uva.nl/special\_collections/overview.cfm](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203111640/http:/www.uba.uva.nl/special_collections/overview.cfm "http://www.uba.uva.nl/special\_collections/overview.cfm")

Thank you! Now my trip is worth the while.

KTKM
